meanings.definition: To move quickly and directly towards a destination.
meanings.sent1: The cat was beelining towards its food bowl.
meanings.sent2: She beelined to the front of the line at the store.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was beelining towards the acorn stash, eager to feast.
meanings.sent4: The athlete beelined towards the finish line, leaving competitors behind.
meanings.sent5: The student beelined towards the library to borrow a book for research.

meanings.sent1: The bee was beelining back to the hive with nectar.
meanings.sent2: He beelined through the crowd to reach his friend on the other side.
meanings.sent3: The dog beelined towards the treat jar, hoping for a snack.
meanings.sent4: The bird beelined towards the bird feeder, hungry for seeds.
meanings.sent5: The child beelined towards the playground, excited to play on the swings.
